Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Membership in organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation of IRPA sections 34(1)(b) and (f) regarding 'subversion by force'
Crimes.Application_Facts: Haqi, a member of KDPI, argued that the organization’s actions were justified under international law and that temporal membership should be considered
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Board's interpretation of IRPA was reasonable
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Membership in KDPI, an organization found to engage in subversive activities
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error in Board's jurisdiction and interpretation of IRPA
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and scope of KDPI's activities, including use of violence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction and interpretation of statutory provisions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; focus on legal interpretation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Findings on KDPI’s violent acts against governments, including non-military targets
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: KDPI's history of armed conflict and subversion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IRPA prohibits admission of individuals belonging to organizations engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential threat to Canadian security through association with subversive group
Crimes.Cause_Description: Haqi was deemed inadmissible due to KDPI's history of subversive activities
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board relied on established evidence of KDPI’s activities
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether the Board had authority to interpret 'subversion by force'
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board reasonably assessed KDPI as engaging in subversion
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: KDPI engaged in violent acts beyond self-defense or legitimate resistance

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration laws
Crimes.Violation_Type: Membership in organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation of IRPA sections 34(1)(b) and (f) regarding 'subversion by force'
Crimes.Application_Facts: Haqi, a KDPI member, claimed actions were justified under international law; Board found KDPI engaged in subversive activities regardless of motivation
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Board's interpretation and jurisdiction
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No unreasonable interpretation of IRPA provisions
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Continued membership in KDPI, an organization involved in subverting the Iranian government
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that Board misinterpreted 'subversion by force'
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of KDPI’s activities and their characterization under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Challenge to Board’s jurisdiction and statutory interpretation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; decision based on organizational conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Documentation of KDPI’s armed operations against Iranian state institutions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: KDPI’s sustained campaign of violence against government entities
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IRPA deems individuals inadmissible for membership in subversive organizations
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk associated with supporting groups using force to overthrow governments
Crimes.Cause_Description: Haqi was deemed inadmissible due to membership in KDPI, which engaged in subversion of the Iranian government
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board applied consistent standards in evaluating foreign organization conduct
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether Board correctly interpreted its mandate under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: KDPI classified as engaging in subversive activities
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Motivations or justifications under international law do not negate subversive nature under IRPA

Crimes.Crime_Name: Membership in an organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Association with armed opposition group using violence to destabilize a government
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Potential risk to international peace and security through support of violent regime change
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Membership in organization employing armed attacks against state and civilian targets
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Armed insurgency, guerrilla warfare, attacks on military and civilian infrastructure
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Affiliation with organization conducting subversive operations
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of KDPI activities, public records, expert analysis
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether KDPI’s actions constitute 'subversion by force' under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: High – based on established reports and prior determinations
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Haqi is inadmissible due to membership in KDPI
Crimes.Process: Administrative inadmissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to present evidence and argument before the Board
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Challenge to Board’s interpretation of 'subversion by force'
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – due to inadmissibility on security grounds
